Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2017 03:06PM Suslev23 wrote: Nile,  I’ve also been diagnosed with this LC. I’ve had lung mets since the beginning (I was diagnosed stage IV to begin with, in January). If you google LC, it looks BAD. I’m not sure what help I can be, other then A fellow LC patient. My doctor, seems ridiculously positive about the LC. I have asked her many times to be straight with me and she seems to be treating it like typical lung mets. I really trust her, but I am also scared of the information floating around the internet. Just finished first cycle of xeloda, breathing has yet to improve. Are you symptomatic? She’s hoping to give me a couple more weeks of xeloda before we rescan. Basically LC is inflammation in the lungs caused by tumor blocking parts of bronchial tube- or so I think. What is your MO saying? I’m so sorry you’re going through this, but it is nice to know I’m not alone.
Posts.Title: Lymphangitis carisinomatosis Nilelady2016 Sharjin

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2017 03:15PM Suslev23 wrote: I have been on steroids in the past but they didn’t do much. My SOB away getting worse so MO sent me for CAT scan and turns out I have pneumonia. So currently on antibiotics for that. I haven’t heard yet if the lymphangitic spread was better or worse. Be careful traveling!
Posts.Title: Lymphangitis carisinomatosis Nilelady2016 Sharjin

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2018 10:53AM Suslev23 wrote: hi Karina, I was originally on gem + carbo - and my hemoglobin were so low I was just really struggling. My genomic testing came back (7 months later) and shows that I have a mutated gene that makes me sensitive to carbo. So my MO cut out the gemzar to see if it makes it easier on me. I’ve had one dose of just carbo thus far, and I’m not sure if it’s better or not. I am still very fatigued but I never know if maybe that’s from lack of conditioning from not doing a lot. Getting a port put in Wednesday as my veins are officially shot after a year of treatment. I have not lost any hair on my head from carbo or gem!! I’ve noticed my body hair has thinned majorly (don’t need to shave my armpits very often!) but my head hair is perfectly in place.  Good luck! Let me know if I can answer any questions you have
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Stage IV Renae64 thrivingmama

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2018 12:05AM Suslev23 wrote: have you asked to finish the last two with just carboplatin? I can just tell you that I was MISERABLE on gemzar and carbo... went to carbo weekly and it’s muhx more manageable.  Also as someone who is stage IV, I think if you can get through two more treatments it gives you a little more insurance!  Good luck!
